job.description:
Title: Software Engineer II
evo Purpose
: To make life better by building community and igniting the adventurous spirit that lives within us all.
evo is a leading multi-channel retail brand that stands at the intersection of community, commerce, adventure sports, and the outdoor lifestyle. We offer a distinctly-curated product assortment, and highly-crafted customer experiences. At evo, we define success differently than most, balancing three goals equally: 1) Building an iconic brand and business; 2) creating an extraordinary place and path for our team; and 3) leveraging our success to drive community impact. We are a company driven by our purpose and values, with a collective passion for community, sports and lifestyle, and a drive to together build something that lasts and matters.
The evo team is comprised of hard-working, passionate individuals who believe curiosity, humility, and human connection are the foundation of progress. We are driven by a belief that we are better together, and we do our best work when we feel included, valued, supported, and united in our purpose. We share our successes and learn together when things don't go as planned.
The Job
evo is looking for a mid-level Software Engineer to join our dynamic and growing Technology team. As Software Engineer II on our Web Experience team, you’ll work closely with end-users across the business and a cross-functional team to improve our ecommerce website and the employee-facing tools used to manage the customer experience.
What you will do
Design, implement, and maintain web-based software and systems alongside other engineers by:
building well-defined medium to large-sized features
participating in code reviews
investigating and fixing bugs
writing and executing unit tests
supporting business users
Provide guidance and assistance to entry-level and support engineers in the form of pair programming, pull request reviews, or other daily interactions
Contribute to functional specifications for small features
Communicate progress to team leads with an emphasis on identifying blocking issues
Collaborate with third-party vendors to deliver solutions, where applicable
Research new and evolving technologies, reporting back to the team with concise findings
What you will need
Holds a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science or other related field
Has at least two years’ full-time professional experience in software engineering
Demonstrates strong comprehension of at least one object-oriented language, preferably C#
Demonstrates strong comprehension of front-end web technologies including CSS, HTML, and JavaScript, preferably Angular
Understands Computer Science fundamentals, including algorithms, data structures, design patterns, etc.
Breathes problem solving and critical thinking with a measure of enthusiasm, patience, tenacity, and thoroughness
Understands and maintains high-quality coding standards
Is excited and inspired by the phrase “optimizing business processes”
Can handle high pressure or emergency response situations without their forehead veins bursting
Ability to build trust with our end users by demonstrating patience and empathy
Self-motivated team player with great communication skills
Excellent critical thinking abilities and sound judgment to assess requirements
Nice-to-have:
Deep understanding of the ASP.NET Core framework
Experience with and ability to demonstrate understanding of cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS
Experience with Atlassian products: Jira, Service Desk, Bitbucket, etc.
Experience with the Kanban software development workflow
At evo, we are working to build and nurture a culture where equity, inclusivity, and compassion are inherent to how we operate and evolve. We recognize and value the uniqueness of each individual's experiences and understand the power in the diversity of ideas and opinions. Guided by our values and mission to promote more inclusive outdoor spaces, we are working to develop a team that is equally representative of the community we hope to build.
While there is more work to be done, we are in the process of evolving our toolset. We are committed to providing the space, support, and resources necessary for each individual to feel heard and valued. If you are interested in contributing your unique voice to our journey, we welcome you to apply!
evo is an equal opportunity employer. We believe the participation of individuals of diverse ages, races, religions, cultures, abilities and personalities will add to personal development and organizational success. All employees and potential employees will be recruited, selected, trained, and promoted without regard to sex, sexual orientation, race, religion, marital or military status, age, national origin, color, the presence of any mental, physical, or sensory disability, genetic information, gender identity, political ideology, or any other basis prohibited by law.
